intro: Symplocos ovatibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Symplocos ovatibracteata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ecological value in supporting local wildlife.
